articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER, AAMER MADHANI and MATTHEW LEE
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Biden administration said Friday that Israel's use of U.S.-provided weapons in Gaza likely violated international humanitarian law but that wartime conditions prevented U.S. officials from determining that for certain in specific airstrikes.
articles.title: US says Israel’s use of US arms likely violated international law, but evidence is incomplete

articles.author: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSEPH KRAUSS
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Heavy fighting between Israeli troops and Palestinian militants on the outskirts of the southern Gaza city of Rafah has left crucial nearby aid crossings inaccessible and forced more than 110,000 people to flee north, U.N.
articles.title: Heavy fighting in Gaza's Rafah keeps aid crossings closed and sends 110,000 civilians fleeing

articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ, JENNIFER PELTZ, MICHAEL R. SISAK and ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — With Donald Trump’s fixer-turned-foe Michael Cohen expected to take the witness stand Monday, the judge in the former president’s hush money case issued prosecutors a stern warning: Get Cohen to stop his taunting posts and jabs at Trump.
articles.title: Judge directs Michael Cohen to keep quiet about Trump ahead of his hush money trial testimony

articles.author: BRUCE SHIPKOWSKI and MICHAEL CASEY
articles.description: Police made dozens of arrests as pro-Palestinian protest encampments were dismantled Friday at the University of Pennsylvania and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, hours after police tear-gassed demonstrators and took down a similar camp at the University of Arizona.
articles.title: Police arrest dozens as they break up pro-Palestinian protests at several US universities

articles.author: MATTHEW BARAKAT
articles.description: A Virginia school board voted Friday to restore the names of Confederate military leaders to a high school and an elementary school, four years after the names were removed amid nationwide protests calling for a reckoning over racial injustice.
articles.title: In reversal, Virginia school board votes to restore Confederate names to 2 schools

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A federal appeals court panel on Friday upheld the criminal conviction of Donald Trump’s longtime ally Steve Bannon for defying a subpoena from the House committee that investigated the attack on the U.S.
articles.title: Appeals court upholds Steve Bannon's contempt of Congress conviction

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — An unusually strong solar storm hitting Earth could produce northern lights in the U.S. this weekend and potentially disrupt power and communications.The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration issued a rare severe geomagnetic storm warning when a solar outburst reached Earth on Friday afternoon, hours sooner than anticipated.
articles.title: Strong solar storm hits Earth, could disrupt communications and produce northern lights in US

articles.author: JIM MUSTIAN
articles.description: FARMERVILLE, La. (AP) — Mona Hardin has been waiting five long years for any resolution to the federal investigation into her son’s deadly arrest by Louisiana State Police troopers, an anguish only compounded by the fact that nearly every other major civil rights case during that time has passed her by.
articles.title: 'Where's Ronald Greene's justice?': 5 years on, feds still silent on Black motorist's deadly arrest

articles.description: WICHITA, Kan. (AP) — A 45-year-old man has pleaded guilty in the theft of a bronze Jackie Robinson statue that was cut off at the ankles and found days later smoldering in a trash can in a city park in Kansas.
articles.title: Man pleads guilty in theft of bronze Jackie Robinson statue from Kansas park

articles.author: ALICIA RANCILIO
articles.description: A new generation can learn how to paint happy trees and to make happy accidents with a TV series teaching the Bob Ross -method of painting using some of the prolific artist's work that have never been seen before.
articles.title: Bob Ross' legacy lives on in new 'The Joy of Painting' series
